flex2.tools.oem

Interface Builder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Application, BuilderApplication, BuilderLibrary, Library

    public interface Builder
    The Builder interface lists the common configuration and build-cycle methods. The Application and Library classes both implement this interface.
    Version:
    2.0.1
    Author:
    Clement Wong
    See Also:
    Application, Library

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int FAIL
      Application.compile() or Library.compile() failed to compile.
      static int LINK
      Application.compile() or Library.compile() did not compile but advise the caller to link again.
      static int OK
      Application.compile() or Library.compile() compiled successfully.
      static int SKIP
      Application.compile() or Library.compile() did not compile anything.

    • Method Detail

      • setConfiguration

        void setConfiguration(Configuration configuration)
        Sets the compiler options for this object. You use the getDefaultConfiguration() method to get a Configuration object.
        Parameters:
        configuration - An instance of an object that implements the Configuration interface.
        See Also:
        Configuration

      • getDefaultConfiguration

        Configuration getDefaultConfiguration()
        Gets the default compiler options. The default values are specified in the flex-config.xml file. You can override the default values by using methods of the Configuration interface.

        This method returns the default compiler options in new Configuration objects.

        Returns:
        An instance of an object that implements the Configuration interface.
        See Also:
        Configuration

      • getConfiguration

        Configuration getConfiguration()
        Gets the compiler options for this object. Unlike the getDefaultConfiguration() method, this method returns null if the setConfiguration() method was not called.
        Returns:
        An instance of an object that implements the Configuration interface.
        See Also:
        Configuration

      • getCompilerBenchmarks

        Map<String,PerformanceData[]> getCompilerBenchmarks()
        Gets the performance data for each compiler phase for the last build.
        Returns:
        A map of compiler phase to PerformanceData.

      • getBenchmark

        Benchmark getBenchmark()
        Gets the overall performance data for the last build.
        Returns:
        a Benchmark object.

      • setLogger

        void setLogger(Logger logger)
        Sets the logger for this object. The compiler uses the logger to notify clients of events that occurred during the compilation.
        Parameters:
        logger - An object that implements the Logger interface.
        See Also:
        Logger

      • getLogger

        Logger getLogger()
        Gets the logger for this object. This method returns null if the setLogger() method was not called.
        Returns:
        An object that implements the Logger interface.
        See Also:
        Logger

      • setSupportedFileExtensions

        void setSupportedFileExtensions(String mimeType,
                              String[] extensions)
        Sets the custom file extensions for this object. For example: 
         setSupportedFileExtensions(flex2.compiler.util.MimeMappings.MXML, new String[] {".foo"});
        This example instructs the compiler to treat files with the *.foo extension as MXML documents. The supported MIME types are specified in the flex2.compiler.util.MimeMappings class as constants.
        Parameters:
        mimeType - MIME type.
        extensions - An array of file extensions.

      • setProgressMeter

        void setProgressMeter(ProgressMeter meter)
        Sets the progress meter for this object. This method is optional. You can set a progress meter so that it receives periodic updates during the compilation.
        Parameters:
        meter - An object that implements the ProgressMeter interface.
        See Also:
        ProgressMeter

      • setPathResolver

        void setPathResolver(PathResolver resolver)
        Sets the path resolver for this object. This method is optional.
        Parameters:
        resolver - A path resolver
        See Also:
        PathResolver

      • setApplicationCache

        void setApplicationCache(ApplicationCache applicationCache)
        Sets the application cache to be shared by all the applications and libraries in the current workspace.
        Parameters:
        applicationCache - The cache.

      • setSwcCache

        void setSwcCache(LibraryCache libraryCache)
        Sets the library cache to be shared by all the applications and libraries in the current project.
        Parameters:
        libraryCache - The cache.

      • build

        long build(boolean incremental)
           throws IOException
        Builds the object. If the incremental input argument is false, this method recompiles all parts of the object. If the incremental input argument is true, this method compiles only the parts of the object that have changed since the last compilation.

        You must call the setOutput() method before calling this method. The result is saved to the location specified by the getOutput() method. If there is no output destination specified, this method does nothing and returns 0.

        Parameters:
        incremental - If true, build incrementally; if false, rebuild.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes written out.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown when an I/O error occurs during compilation.
        See Also:
        Application, Library

      • build

        long build(OutputStream out,
         boolean incremental)
           throws IOException
        Builds the object. If the incremental input argument is false, this method recompiles all parts of the object. If the incremental input argument is true, this method compiles only the parts of the object that have changed since the last compilation.

        This method only outputs to the specified OutputStream. For better performance, the OutputStream should be buffered. This method does not output to the destination specified by the setOutput() method.

        Parameters:
        out - The OutputStream.
        incremental - If true, build incrementally; if false, rebuild.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes written out. This method returns 0 if the object fails to compile.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown when an I/O error occurs during compilation.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Stops the compilation. If the client runs the compiler in a background thread, it can use this method to stop the compilation. The compiler does not stop immediately, but stops the compilation when it reaches a stable state.

      • clean

        void clean()
        If you called the setOutput() method, this method deletes the Application or Library file. Calls to the build() method trigger a full recompilation.

        The clean() method does not remove compiler options or reset the output location.

      • load

        void load(InputStream in)
          throws IOException
        Loads compilation data from a previous compilation. This method is usually called before the build() method.
        Parameters:
        in - The InputStream.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown when an I/O error occurs while loading the compilation data.

      • save

        long save(OutputStream out)
          throws IOException
        Saves the current compilation data. This method is usually called after the build() method.

        Do not use this to create a SWF or SWC file. Use the build() method instead.

        Parameters:
        out - The OutputStream.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes written out.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown when an I/O error occurs while saving the compilation data.

      • getReport

        Report getReport()
        Reports information about the current compilation. This method returns null if you have not yet called the build(boolean), build(OutputStream, boolean), or compile(boolean) methods.

        The Report object includes the following information:

        1. Number of source files used in the compilation.
        2. The location of the source files.
        3. Number of asset files that are embedded in the Application or Library.
        4. The location of the asset files.
        5. The dependencies of the source files.

        You must call the getReport() method to get a new report after each call to the build() method.

        Returns:
        An object that implements the Report interface.

      • getOutput

        File getOutput()
